header.title: The best fence installation company in Redwood City
bullets: FREE online tool to create your own custom quote.
Friendly, honest customer service from our Ergeon team!
Beautiful fence built by our skilled local contractors.

Yelp.description: I absolutely give 5 stars and wonder why anyone could not have. From quotes to project manager to install team, this team was amazing. They helped me juggle multiple neighbor negotiations, unforeseen tree issues, and found answers to all. I'm MOST appreciative of the character of this company and the competant teams they employ.... thank you
Yelp.name: Suzanne M.
Yelp.title: I'm MOST appreciative of the character of this company and the competant teams they employ.

Google.description: Our existing fence needed to be replaced and out of all the companies I called, Ergeon was the only one that got back to me during these covid times. Rather than sending someone out for an estimate, I worked virtually with Kelly via GoogleMeet. I flipped over to the rear camera and showed her the damage. She walked me through on getting measurements and answered all of my questions. So awesome (and convenient)! I received an estimate within the week and we look forward to doing business with them.
Google.name: Jay C.
Google.title: I received an estimate within the week and we look forward to doing business with them.

articles.description: If you’re looking to get a new fence in California, it’s important to know about the laws surrounding fences and home improvement projects. Our post will go over some important things to keep in mind.

When it’s time to get a new fence it’s important to always use a reputable, licensed, and insured contractor. Some people try to cut costs by using unlicensed contractors, but this can end up being a major issue if any problems happen during the installation or down the line. In this post, we’ll go over the main reasons why you should always use a licensed and insured fence contractor.

There’s a lot to consider when weighing the pros and cons of a wood fence versus a chain link fence. We’ve tried to make the process easier for you by diving deeper into some of the areas of consideration.
